title: Is technology the future of education? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, surely technology is significantly important and has completely overhauled the way education is imparted in present times. Technology in many forms and specifically mobile technologies has paved a path towards digitized education, adding flexibility and improving students productivity is a big way. There are many advantages that mobile technologies are providing- Added flexibility and 360-degree learning, beyond the school hoursImproved and growing interest among students to explore, ideate and learnImproved productivity and efficiency among studentsEasing our remote learning and remote teachingImproved and more scientific form of learningMobile technologies and mobile devices were quite an inhibition for educational organizations, owing to the implicit challenges it can bring forth. However, with innovations and cloud solutions like mobile device management for education, introducing mobile technologies has been secured and managed. The infusion of mobile devices and apps in education has been so extensive and useful in education, that organizations are increasingly opting to replace the conventional form of learning and choosing to allow mobile devices like Tablets, Smartphones, Notebooks etc for learning and education. Classroom mobility strategies like Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) is also been implemented, allowing students to bring their own personal devices for learning. However, with MDM solutions for education the access and usage of educational data and information on the devices are managed and secured. Mobile devices among students managed with mobile device management solutions have also been leveraging remote learning, providing a way for students to continue education from any desired location. Here is a blog which you can read to get a detailed overview of 5 ways MDM for Education helps in remote learning and distance education

I am not a teacher or professor by training. I worked in IT in education for 11 years. A funny man about 6–8 years ago made a statement that said roughly:” technology will replace all humans in training humans in the future, it is a matter of time and technology.” The man who said this was Steve Wozniak. He explained that AI with enough power will become the best teacher because it will be able to read your individual body language, blood pressure, attention span, etc etc. So it will be able to adapt to your learning style as well as know when to both push you and slow down depending on your response and through body metrics. So instead of a classroom of 10–30 kids or more, it will always be 1 on 1 and moving at exactly the pace to maximize your education. BUT he also said even at the rate of technological innovation this is a decade or 10 away. The point he was making is that with AI and enough data it will be the pinnacle of education without delving into science fiction where computers could just write information into your brain like a memory device.
